byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and ALEXANDER BURNS
byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer reported from Washington, and Alexander Burns from New York. Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: After the House speaker said he couldn’t endorse Mr. Trump, the presumptive Republican nominee fired back that he was “not ready to support Speaker Ryan’s agenda.”

headline.print_headline: Ryan ‘Not Ready’ to Support Trump, in A Rare Rebuke
headline.main: Paul Ryan Says He Is ‘Not Ready’ to Endorse Donald Trump

snippet: After the House speaker said he couldn’t endorse Mr. Trump, the presumptive Republican nominee fired back that he was “not ready to support Speaker Ryan’s agenda.”
abstract: House Speaker Paul D Ryan says that he is not yet prepared to extend his endorsement to presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump; announcement, in which he questions Trump's principles,  reveals party's deep division while also offering other conservative politicians relief from pressure to back candidate.
